metadata.title: CVE-2018-11212 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libjpeg 9a and 9d. The alloc_sarray function injmemmgr.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(divide-by-zero error) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
libturbojpeg-java - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
libturbojpeg - 1:2.1.5-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

libjpeg-progs - 1:9c-2
libjpeg9 - 1:9c-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg6b package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
libjpeg-turbo package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-0ubuntu5').
libjpeg-turbo package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-0ubuntu5').
libjpeg9 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9c-2').
